skills.title: Iconography Enhancement and Stylization

skills.title: Visual Storytelling through Illustration

skills.title: Infographic Creation and Complex Visual Storytelling
skills.description: The ability to synthesize information into a compelling visual narrative. This involves combining multiple asset types (maps, icons, text, custom shapes) and creating graphic elements (like timelines or diagrams) to guide the viewer. It requires a strong command of visual hierarchy and composition.

skills.category: Working with flat vectors from MM
skills.title: Creating Visual Metaphors for Strategic Concepts
skills.description: The ability to conceptualize and execute a visual metaphor (like a mountain representing challenges and goals). This involves building a complex illustration where each element holds symbolic meaning that reinforces the core message.

skills.category: Working with flat vectors from MM
skills.title: Creating Scenes and Environments with Vectors
skills.description: The ability to construct a complete scene using vector characters and objects. This involves creating interaction between elements, establishing an environment, and applying effects like transparency or gradients to give a sense of depth and realism.

skills.category: Working with flat vectors from MM
skills.title: Illustrating Processes and Journeys
skills.description: The ability to visualize a step-by-step process or journey. This involves using illustrations, icons, and connectors to show a logical sequence of events, customizing assets to fit each stage of the process.

skills.category: Working with flat vectors from MM
skills.title: Comprehensive Visual Redesign and Enhancement
skills.description: A complete visual overhaul of a slide. This involves not only updating graphics (using techniques like clipping masks for more dynamic visuals) but also restructuring the layout and typography to communicate the message more impactfully.

skills.category: Working with flat vectors from MM
skills.title: Content Integration within Illustrations (Masking)
skills.description: The ability to believably merge an image or graphic within another vector element (e.g., a picture inside a rocket). This requires mastery of clipping masks and node editing to adjust the container's shape, ensuring the content integrates seamlessly.

skills.category: Working with flat vectors from MM
skills.title: Creative and Thematic Adaptation of Illustrations
skills.description: The ability to take a request and execute it with a creative and memorable twist (e.g., replacing humans with penguins). The skill lies in professionally executing this stylistic choice, adding personality while maintaining visual consistency.

skills.title: Creative Layout Design and Color Treatment
skills.description: The ability to transform a text-heavy slide into a visually engaging piece. This focuses on creating a dynamic layout, using geometric shapes, and applying color gradients and effects to generate visual interest and depth.

skills.title: Vector Recreation and Tracing
skills.description: The skill of reconstructing a low-resolution graphic (like a screenshot) into a clean, scalable, and editable vector artwork. Requires expert use of the Pen Tool for Bézier curves and boolean operations or the Shape Builder tool to construct complex shapes.

skills.title: Technical Diagram Recreation in Vector
skills.description: Similar to general vector tracing, but focused on the precision required for technical diagrams. The key skill is accuracy, recreating lines, shapes, and flows faithfully using guides and alignment tools for a professional vector representation.

skills.title: Iconography Stylization (Hand-Drawn Style)
skills.description: The ability to create or modify graphics to adopt a specific "hand-drawn" style. This is achieved by adjusting stroke properties to be irregular and modifying curves to be imperfect, applying a visual style that feels organic and less corporate.

skills.title: Integrating 2D Elements into Isometric Scenes
skills.description: The ability to take a flat element (like a logo) and correctly project it onto one of the surfaces (isometric planes) of an isometric illustration. This creates the illusion that the element is part of the scene, requiring the use of perspective or isometric plane tools.

skills.title: Composing and Enhancing Isometric Scenes
skills.description: The ability to add complexity and detail to an existing isometric illustration. This involves selecting and placing additional icons and sketches onto the correct planes so the scene feels more "alive" and informative without breaking the isometric perspective.

skills.title: Editing and Annotating Isometric Graphics
skills.description: The ability to interpret visual feedback (like annotations) and perform precise edits on an isometric illustration. This involves modifying, adding, or removing specific elements while maintaining the style and perspective consistency of the graphic.

skills.title: Storytelling in Isometric Environments
skills.description: Using an isometric scene to tell a story or compare two states. This involves modifying elements (a burning building vs. a normal one) to visually represent a problem and a solution, all within the same coherent isometric perspective.

skills.title: Recreating Isometric Scenes from Reference
skills.description: The ability to observe a screenshot or concept and rebuild it from scratch as a clean, professional isometric illustration. This involves setting up an isometric grid and drawing or placing each element on its corresponding plane to achieve the characteristic 3D effect.

skills.title: Complex Isometric Diagramming from Feedback
skills.description: The ability to decode complex annotations on a mock-up and translate them into a functional and visually clear isometric illustration. This requires not only isometric drawing skills but also interpretation skills to ensure the final diagram communicates the desired flow.

skills.title: Isometric Flowchart Creation
skills.description: Designing a process diagram using an isometric perspective. The skill involves representing a flow of information or production in a three-dimensional manner, using connectors and elements that respect the perspective to give a sense of space and structure.

skills.title: Converting Flat Design to Isometric
skills.description: The ability to take a 2D (flat) diagram and "extrude" or redraw it in an isometric perspective. This involves establishing an isometric grid and transforming each flat shape into its isometric equivalent, adding depth and a three-dimensional look.

skills.title: High-Fidelity Isometric Recreation
skills.description: Reconstructing a complex isometric illustration from a reference image, paying close attention to details, colors, gradients, and transparencies so the final result is a high-quality, editable replica.

skills.title: Object Isolation with Vector Masking
skills.description: The ability to precisely and non-destructively cut out an object from its background using vector masks. Using the Pen Tool to create the mask allows for maximum control over the edges, resulting in a clean, professional cutout.

skills.title: Photo Compositing and Blending
skills.description: The art of integrating multiple images so they appear as a single, coherent scene. This involves cutting out elements from different photos and then adjusting their color, light, and scale to blend them realistically.

skills.title: Basic Background Removal
skills.description: A fundamental photo editing skill: isolating the main subject of an image by removing the background. This can be done with various tools to prepare the image for use in other designs.

skills.title: Selective Color Correction in Photos
skills.description: The ability to modify the color of a specific part of an image without affecting the rest. This is achieved by making a precise selection of the object and then applying non-destructive color adjustments (like HSL) to match the object's color to a brand palette.

skills.title: Brand Neutralization and Mockup Adaptation
skills.description: The ability to take a mockup or photo with a specific brand and remove or replace all branding elements with neutral or alternative ones. This requires a combination of masking, cloning, digital painting, and overlaying new graphic elements.

skills.title: High-End Photo and Text Composition
skills.description: Creating a high-quality visual composition that merges an impactful photograph with professional typography. The skill is not just in choosing the right photo, but in how the text is integrated—its hierarchy, color, and interaction with the image to create a premium result.

skills.title: Original Graphic Creation from Copyrighted References
skills.description: The ability to analyze a copyrighted reference and, instead of copying it, create a new, original design that captures the same essence, structure, and purpose. This involves a full creative process: conceptualization, icon and layout design, and execution.
